thread.title: I Can't Believe This Motorcycle Mosh Pit Is Actually A Sport
thread.title_full: I Can't Believe This Motorcycle Mosh Pit Is Actually A Sport

author: gizmodo
title: I Can't Believe This Motorcycle Mosh Pit Is Actually A Sport
text:
Screen capture via King of the Hammers on Facebook While you were out drinking last night, about 90 lunatics on dirt bikes were going to war with each other over ridiculous terrain in the pitch-black Mojave desert. Just... just watch.


All this week, hordes of gearheads, racers and adrenaline junkies are descending upon the rocky wasteland that is Johnson Valley, California to be part of King Of The Hammers 2017.


The Mojave Desert Like You've Never Seen: Lit Up With Lasers And Fire The Mojave Desert Like You've Never Seen: Lit Up With Lasers And Fire The Mojave Desert Like You've Never Seen: Lit Up… Johnson Valley, California hosts some of the wildest and most accessible off-road racing events in… Read more Read more 
KOH is the championship race of the Ultra4 series, which is a competition of “cars” that are essentially steroidal Jeeps with huge engines, huge tires and suspension travel. But the “event” has since grown to be a weeklong celebration of desert racing, this year starting Feb. 3 and continuing through Feb. 11.
Advertisement 

Advertisement 

The KOH race itself takes place on Feb. 10, I hope to be there from the 9th to the 11th (say hi!) , but the motorcycle element called King Of The Motos is underway as I write this.
KOM is broken into three races: Saturday night’s “night race” you saw in the video, a fast desert race Sunday and an extremely technical off-road race also on Sunday.
I haven’t seen any “official” action go down at night at KOH week myself, but we got some great photos from the 2015 event to give you a glimpse at what the atmosphere’s like .
